page.title: 03Roman coins, Rossall
page.content: 401 Roman coins were found near the landmark at Rossall Point, Fleetwood. Mr Hardwick reported that they were coins the dates ranging from AD70 to AD217. They were said to be in the possesion of Sir Hesketh Fleetwood at Rossall Hall. The hoard was found by Alderman Brown who passed it onto his son Dr Brown who presented the 401 coins to the Museum of Preston. The coins turned out to be a hoard of an entirely different date; AD353-Ad408 and the following emperors; Constantius 2, Julianus, Valentinuanus 1, Valens, Gratianus, Magnus Maximus, Flavius Victor, Valentinianus 2, Theodosius 1, Egenius, Arcadius & Honorius. This list proves the hoard to be the latest yet found in Lancashire, probably concealed in the 5thC when the Romans left. Those of Flavios Victor & Eugenius are rare.
